channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Debunked Science Led to Death Row for One Man
item.description: Charles Don Flores deserves a trial based on evidence, not on discredited science.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Netanyahu Clashes With His Defense Minister Over War Aims
item.description: The rift comes at the start of a critical week when U.S. and Arab mediators are preparing to present a “final” proposal for a cease-fire in Gaza, and Israel is bracing for a response from Iran and Hezbollah to the killings of two militant leaders.

item.title: $3 billion energy giant admits violating pollution limits in Louisiana—just like it did in Mississippi
item.description: Drax Global is already under scrutiny for running afoul of environmental laws in multiple states.

item.title: Elections Officials Battle a Deluge of Disinformation
item.description: County clerks and secretaries of state are overwhelmed this year, as they stare down a “perpetual moving target” of new conspiracy theories, political pressure and threats.

item.title: U.S. Orders Submarine to Middle East Amid Fears of Escalation
item.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III spoke with his Israeli counterpart, Yoav Gallant, the Pentagon said. In an unusual disclosure, it said Mr. Austin had ordered a submarine to the Middle East.

item.title: U.S. debt interest costs are about to blow past $1 trillion this fiscal year
item.description: The Federal Reserve’s aggressive interest-rate hiking campaign, aimed at quelling inflation, has made debt more expensive to issue.

item.title: Why Iran Has Waited to Retaliate Against Israel for Hamas Leader’s Killing
item.description: Tehran is under pressure to avenge the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, but analysts said it is balancing multiple factors as it weighs a response.

item.title: Why Iran Has Waited to Retaliate Against Israel for Hamas Leader’s Killing
item.description: Tehran is under pressure to avenge the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, but analysts said it is balancing multiple factors as it weighs a response.

item.title: Texas AG launches investigation into Houston utility company after power outages left some residents dead in their homes
item.description: Hurricane Beryl knocked out power to nearly 3 million people, and was responsible for at least three dozen deaths.

item.title: What Donald Trump Calling Kamala Harris a ‘Communist’ Shows
item.description: MAGA desperately turns to old-fashioned red-baiting.

item.title: Russia, Facing Ukrainian Incursion Into Kursk, Maintains Pressure in East
item.description: Russian forces are pummeling Ukrainian positions along the front lines, Ukrainian military officials said, as attacks on Russian soil by Ukraine continue.

item.title: Stocks usually take 6 months to recover from the type of selloff that just hit markets, BofA says
item.description: Following such pullbacks, 12-month returns on stocks were positive 73% of the time, analysts said.

item.title: Russia, Facing Ukrainian Incursion Into Kursk, Maintains Pressure in East
item.description: Russian forces are pummeling Ukrainian positions along the front lines, Ukrainian military officials said, as attacks on Russian soil by Ukraine continue.

item.title: Man Arrested After Woman and Girl Stabbed in London’s Leicester Square
item.description: A girl, 11, and a woman, 34, were attacked in the often-crowded Leicester Square, the police said. Neither suffered life-threatening injuries.

item.title: Nate Silver charts the course of risk-taking, from Sam Bankman-Fried to Sam Altman
item.description: For Nate Silver poker, Sam Bankman-Fried, and the future of AI are all connected by one thing—risk-taking.
